radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis and a 4-mm pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe, stable for almost ___ years. A tiny 4-mm hypodense lesion in the dome of the liver, likely a simple cyst or hemangioma. 14-mm extraluminal collection of predominantly air with some fluid adjacent to an inflamed segment of the sigmoid colon with surrounding inflammatory fat stranding. Few diverticulae present.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Stable pulmonary nodule for almost ___ years.
